column3: We have several actions that auto sync remote sources locally, I am guessing similar to AutoSVN updater. For this we inherit 'AbstractCommonUpdateAction'. Unfortunately we need a little bit more control of the action that 'AbstractCommonUpdateAction' offers, so we added some extensions. The other option would be not to inherit 'AbstractCommonUpdateAction' and instead copy the code. We'd really like to avoid doing this as 'AbstractCommonUpdateAction' implementation handles some very esoteric low level details and we'd like to ensure we receive any updates/bugfixes to it.

CommitChangeListDialog:
We need to be able to pass a parameter to CheckinEnvironment depending on the CommitExecutor. There is currently no way to do this cleanly. Passing the executor(not null) allows CheckinHandler to pass in a parameter to CheckinEnvironment

@klikh
We're going to be withdrawing this request as we decided to implement our own action fully rather than inheriting from AbstractCommonUpdateAction so we can have better control.

There is a fairly serious 'performance leak' in showing 'UpdateInfoTree' when a large number of files is involved.  When expanded each 'FileTreeNode' registers as a root in 'VirtualFilePointerManager'. This causes VirtualFilePointerManager to traverse a large number of paths for every VFS update. I've seen this cause UI freezes of up to 4 minutes with a large change (over 8k files) followed by a large VFS update.

@klikh I'd still like 8f218e6 merged if possible.  It allows to the 'CheckinHandlerFactory' to pass extra parameters to the CheckinEnvironment via 'additionalDataConsumer' depending on the executor chosen.

For example, right now to handle 'CommitAndPush' you rely on an essentially global variable (myCheckinEnvironment.setNextCommitIsPushed(true)). I think it would be cleaner to pass it as a parameter to the CheckinEnvironment.
We'll check the performance issue in UpdateInfoTree, thanks!
